functions.name: Full-Text
functions.text: This module extends the XQuery Full Text Recommendation with some useful functions: The index can be directly accessed, full-text results can be marked with additional elements, or the relevant parts can be extracted. Moreover, the score value, which is generated by the contains text expression, can be explicitly requested from items. All functions are introduced with the ft: prefix.

function.name: search
function.rule: This function performs an explicit full-text index request on the specified database node and returns all text nodes that contain the string $text. The index full-text options are used for searching, i.e., if the index terms were stemmed, the search string will be stemmed as well.
function.example: The expression ft:search(., "QUERY") returns all text nodes of the currently opened database that contain the string "QUERY".
function.error: is raised if the context item does not represent a database node.

function.name: mark
function.summary: Marks results from a full-text index request.
function.rule: This function puts a marker element around the resulting $nodes of a full-text index request.
The default tag name of the marker element is mark. An alternative tag name can be chosen via the optional $tag argument.
Note that the XML node to be transformed must be an internal "database" node. The transform expression can be used to apply the method to a main-memory fragment (see example).
function.example:
The following query returns <XML><mark>hello</mark> world</XML>, if one text node of the database DB has the value "hello world":
ft:mark(db:open('DB')//*[text() contains text 'hello'])

The following expression returns

word

: copy $p :=

word

modify () return ft:mark($p[text() contains text 'word'], 'b')
function.error: is raised if the context item does not represent a database node.
is raised if $name is no valid QName.

function.name: extract
function.summary: Extracts relevant parts of full-text results.
function.rule: This function extracts and returns relevant parts of full-text results. It puts a marker element around the resulting $nodes of a full-text index request and chops irrelevant sections of the result.
The default tag name of the marker element is mark. An alternative tag name can be chosen via the optional $tag argument.

The default length of the returned text is 150 characters. An alternative length can be specified via the optional $length argument. Note that the effective text length may differ from the specified text due to formatting and readibility issues.
function.example: The following query may return ...hello... if a text node of the database DB contains the string "hello world": ft:extract(db:open('DB')//*[text() contains text 'hello'], 'b', 1)
function.error: is raised if the context item does not represent a database node.
is raised if $name is no valid QName.

function.name: score
function.rule: This function returns the score values (0.0 - 1.0) that have been attached to the specified items. 0 is returned if no score was attached.
function.example: The expression ft:score('a' contains text 'a') returns the xs:double value 1.
